result.execSummary:
The defendant Jashawn L Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $900.00 including all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges; including the DNA surcharge, to be paid by 07/27/15. Bail on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Huber privileges to apply for work. Defendant to report to the House of Correction on 06/09/15.

Court will expunge conviction if the defendant reports on DITR date, pays the additional fines owed, and has no city tickets for marijuana or other arrests rising  to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jashawn L Weaver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Diploma of Graduation, Firearm training certification, Paystub from work, and letter on behalf of the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
Court CANCELLED the order of 3/6/2015 to return bail. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant to report to the House of Correction on 6/9/2015.

Fine of $900.00 including all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges; including the DNA surcharge, to be paid by 7/27/2015. Bail on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court will expunge conviction if the defendant reports on DITR date, pays any additional fines owed, and has no city tickets for marijuana or other arrests rising to the level of probable cause. 

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Jashawn L Weaver in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 2 AND 3 DIsmissed, but Read In.

Defendant Jashawn L Weaver in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jashawn L Weaver in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
$400.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jashawn L Weaver in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/6/15 @ 1:30pm
